. It is actually a unitary authority for all local government functions.  The city of
, which dominates the East Yorkshire economy, tourism and infrastructure, is a separate unitary authority.

The easiest way to get to Beverley is to take the train or the bus from Hull, or the bus from York.

By plane: The nearest airport is Humberside Airport. There are bus, rail and taxi services from the airport. Trains run to Doncaster (change for Hull) and busses run to Hull.

By Rail: Trains run regularly from Hull to Beverley.

By bus: There is a good bus service operated by the East Riding of Yorkshire Council (ERYC). Busses run from Hull and York, as well as other smaller local towns.

By sea: Ferries from Europe to Hull - P&O Ferries
By Coach: On the National Express - National Express
